sermons.title: (Acts) The Basis of the Christian Life
(Acts) What the Church Should Look Like
(Godly Home) Part 26 - Youth - Anointed Disciples of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: "Godly youth will bless and sanctify the atmosphere of your home," says Brother Denny.  He offers 8 ways in which parents can make disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ out of the youth in the home.

sermons.title: (Pdf Book) Stepping into the Breach
sermons.description: Although this arch-enemy, Satan, is attacking our neighbor, or even has him in his hand, we donâ€™t use the weapon of prayerâ€“we donâ€™t step into the breach. Satan doesnâ€™t want us to take his might seri- ously. That is his greatest trick, for then we donâ€™t op- pose him and he can take control of our neighbor, or us, with complete ease. But Jesus has come â€œ... to destroy the works of the devilâ€ (1 John 3:8). And so we must use the victorious name of Jesus in prayer, according to the verse, â€œAll who call upon the name of the LORD shall be deliveredâ€ (Joel 2:32 and Acts 2:21).

sermons.title: (Revival) Part 1 - Phenomena
sermons.description: Martyn-Lloyd Jones treats with the subject of the phenomena that accompany revival. He considers some of the types of manifestations that occur, their causes, the explanations that may be given for them, and what God's purposes may be in them. He warns against quenching the Spirit with intellectualism and also against seeking manifestations in place of the outpouring of the Spirit of God.

sermons.title: (South West Baptist Church 2008) Broken In The Presence Of God
(Wonderful 50 Days) 01 - The Appearance Of Christ
sermons.description: This introductory lesson homes in on the heart of God in the 50 days between Christ's resurrection and the Spirit poured out on Pentecost.  The Old Testament Feast of First Fruits pictures Jesus' resurrection and says in effect: see Jesus.  The message of the 10 days from Jesus ascending and Pentecost is this: wait for the Holy Spirit.  The way that Jesus showed up in those days is the way He will always show up to His people.  (NOTE: Only the first 45 minutes of this message are recorded.)

sermons.title: (basics) 9. The Gift Of The Holy Spirit
05 Principle 1 - Solely Looking to the Person of Jesus Christ
sermons.description: We need the kind of humility that was expressed in the early Church as recorded in the Book of Acts. This kind of humility is today manifested in many underground and persecuted Churches across the world because they have dealt the death blow to pride and independence.39 These persecuted believers have become solely dependent on Jesus Christ as the Head to lead them and guide their meeting as Churches.40 A brother stated this truth, in another way: â€œChrist should be the gathering center of His people. We should be drawn by His presence, not by a man. When believers see this and act upon it, the local Assembly need not be shaken by the departure of any man. An Assembly where Christians gather to Christ has strength, stability and solidarity.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 06 Principle 2 - Where 2 or 3 are Gathered Together
sermons.description: The genesis of a Church in Scripture is seen in this simple statement of our Lord: â€œFor where two or three gather in My Name, there am I with them.â€ A gathering of believers where the Lord Jesus is present is the Church, even if there are only two or three believers there. When believers gather in smaller groups it allows the Lordâ€™s people to meet more frequently during the week, even daily, as the early Church did.57 This provides the confidence and expectation to meet with other wholehearted disciples of Jesus Christ, to meet with the Lord Jesus who is in the midst, to receive direction from the Lord and to benefit from mutual encouragement58 and prayers.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 10 Principle 6 - Not Depending On or Needing Buildings
sermons.description: One of the things you do not find in the Book of Acts is the reliance on church buildings. Yet in almost every Christian circle and denomination, there is an emphasis upon building the church, not that â€œthe body of Christ may be built upâ€112 but rather the building of an actual structure that we refer to commonly as the church. There is a great benefit at times in having a building where the Lordâ€™s people can meet in and use for the ministry of the Gospel. Yet, when we look at the Book of Acts, we find no visible record that the Church built buildings. Though they met in some physical locations such as Solomonâ€™s Colonnade113 and the hall of Tyrannus for even two years!114 Yet, this was not the common practice of how saints met across the rest of Godâ€™s Churches. Even when looking carefully in Church history it is hard to find evidence of a building being used until 300 AD when pagan temples were being converted into churches under the reign of Constantine.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 17 Principle 13 - A Growing Vibrant Movement
sermons.description: The early Church was a growing movement of multiplying house Churches.240 God was adding to the number daily such as would be saved241 and there were many being saved through the preaching of the Gospel. Radical evangelism was not an option in the early Church but the only logical response to the great offer of the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Not just a few but all the disciples242 were gripped with the burden to reach the whole known world with this message of eternal life.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 19 Principle 15 - Not Pleasing Men But God Alone
sermons.description: We must always in our walks with Jesus Christ keep our eyes on the Lord and seek to please Him alone. The fact is that we belong to Jesus Christ. He has redeemed us with His precious blood and therefore we are not our own.272 This is a liberating truth if we can realize that all we do is in the clear view of God and therefore seek His approval alone. The early Church walked in the fear of the Lord273 and did not seek the accolades and esteem of men. â€œThen the Church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 51 Principle 47- The Lord's Day Can Be Everyday
sermons.description: In an underground Church in China in one area the people wake up at 4:30 to come together for two hours to pray and worship, they do this every day. There are Churches that meet in the only place they are safe, a cave! There are Churches that meet on farms far away from prying eyes.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 62 Principle 58- New Converts Every Church Meeting
sermons.description: It is now a normal thing to see many new converts in Iranian House Churches. Iranian believers expect to see new people coming in repentance to Jesus every week. This is very much like the account of the Book of Acts where it says the Church was: â€œPraising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.â€771 In some cases, when they have meetings where there are no stories of a conversion they examine what they have done wrong to hinder the Lord working. Such growth has happened in the last 30 years to where many say conservative estimates put the size of the Iranian house Churches at over one million people.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

95. To whom is Baptism to be administered?
A New Reformation
sermons.description: Martyn-Llyod Jones speaks on the basis of fellowship the early church met under: They devoted themselves to the apostlesâ€™ teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer. He calls for a new reformation of saints gathering in this way in vital gatherings of believers towards Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: Additions to the Church
sermons.description: A SERMON DELIVERED ON LORD'S-DAY MORNING, APRIL 5TH, 1874, BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.”— Acts 2:47. WE are just coming to the most beautiful season of the year — the spring, when everything around us is shaking off the chill grave clothes of winter, and putting on the beautiful array of a new life. The church of God was in that condition at Pentecost, her winter was past, and the flowers appeared on the earth. She enjoyed the spring breezes, for the breath of the Holy Spirit refreshed her garden: there was spring music — the time of the singing of birds was come, for her preachers testified faithfully of Jesus, and so many and varied were the sweet notes which welcomed the new season, that many nations of men heard in their own tongue the wonderful works of God. There was, also, the spring blossoming, the fig tree put forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grapes gave a good smell, for all around multitudes inquired, “Men and brethren, what must we do?” and many also avowed their faith in Jesus. There were the spring showers of repentance, the spring sun-gleams of joy in the Holy Ghost and the spring flowers of newly-given hope and faith. May we behold just such another spring time in all the churches of Jesus Christ throughout the world, and meanwhile let us arouse ourselves suitable to so gladsome a season. Let us rise up and meet the Well-Beloved ...

sermons.title: Christ the Man #3
sermons.description: Again proof through the Scriptures that Jesus was a man.  Christ came as a man, experienced life as a man.  Major Thomas uses a number of Scriptures to confirm Christ’s humanity.

sermons.title: Either Pentecost or Holocaust
sermons.description: Leonard Ravenhill speaks on the dire need of a modern day pentecost upon the church. The one great need of the church is holiness but the one great problem is uncleaness. America is facing the judgement of God having over 250,000 professional preachers yet the nation is not moved to God. Hear this strong appeal to move ourselves out of complancy to a vital relationship with God and the Word of God.

sermons.title: Enduement Of Power - How It Is Obtained
sermons.description: A powerful message on the Baptism of the Holy Spirit experience in the Bible. Brother Denny Kenaston preaches with unction on this very important subject. He shares how God works in many ways to fill people with His Holy Spirit and we cannot put God in a box. The genuine experience of the Holy Spirit is still available to believers today.

sermons.title: Evaluation of the Present Day Renewal
Experiencing Pentecost
sermons.description: The day of Pentecost is the start of the feast of weeks, referred to in Ex 34:22, "And you shall observe the Feast of Weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest." It was when the firstfruits of the crops were brought as a gift to God; everyone had to bring something - not a single man was to appear empty-handed before God. Today some churches still have the tradition to hold this type of feast where the people bring thanksgiving gifts to God. A little boy was present at one of these offerings, and when the others brought their thanksgiving gifts, he realised that he had nothing to give to Jesus. Suddenly he got a bright idea, rushed to the front and got into the gifts basket, saying, "Lord Jesus, I haven't got anything; but I give myself to you". This is a sermon to each one of us.

sermons.title: Filled with the Spirit
sermons.description: Acts 2:1-4 describes the baptism of the Holy Spirit on the Day of Pentecost. It was a glorious day that would change the world forever. The creeds of the early Christian Church gave strong affirmation of the power, oneness and equality of Father, Son and Holy Spirit. All things come from God, through the Son, and by the Holy Spirit. In his message Dr. Fitch explores the work of the Spirit -- He who dwells in the hearts of believers and acts as agent for the Godhead.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 5
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 01/01/1959.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 7
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1959.

sermons.title: How Revival Comes: The Power of the Spirit
How to Pray for Revival
sermons.description: Guzik teaches not only how to pray for revival but when and what to pray.  In addition his careful handling of God's Word, he cites pertinent and interesting examples from revivals from the not-so-distant past such as James McGrady in 1800, the American revival of 1858 and the Welsh revival in early 1900's.  He deals with misconceptions of praying only for leaders and not whole congregations, pointing out from Acts how the Holy Spirit fills both individuals and entire congregations.  Guzik appeals to let go of the 'machinery' of men to earnestly seek God in prayer for 'a unique stirring of the Spirit of God' in our day!

sermons.title: Is This That?
sermons.description: On the day of Pentecost, Peter said, "this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel ..." Vance Havner asks of the modern day church, "Is this that?" Preacher, here's a revival message you'll want to hear.

sermons.title: Los Angeles Conference #1
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 03/01/1962.

sermons.title: Revivals In The Bible by Dean Taylor
sermons.description: Dean Taylor speaks of revivals in the bible in the new testament and old testament histories. This overview is very helpful to give us some clear biblical landmarks to seek God for biblical genuine revival in our day.

sermons.title: Seasons of Refreshing
sermons.description: Fred Tomlinson shares on the subject of revival and the outpouring of the Holy Spirit. This powerful messages has in it many powerful stories and examples of revival and in the end there is a call for believers to be right with God and allow the Holy Spirit to have full reign in the believers life. This message will challenge you to seek God more deeply.

sermons.title: Seven Great Themes in the Acts of the Apostles
Testimony - Part 2
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen takes his time to trace God's working in his heart through salvation into ministry, dissatisfaction, and deeper commitment to know biblical reality in his life and God’s work through him. This second tape shares when revival came! when God came down! What a stirring testimony of God's unchanging ways.

sermons.title: The Power To Speak With a New Tongue
sermons.description: September 8, 2005 - Receiving the Holy Spirit is conditional. Being in one accord and obeying God brings us into a place where God can speak to any area in our life and we would be quick to agree with Him. As we agree with God the Holy Spirit will come upon us and give us the ability to communicate with every language and every culture

sermons.title: The Power of the Holy Ghost (1 of 2)
sermons.description: For anyone struggling with a besetting sin, needing deliverance, this is a must-hear message. Once you commit yourself, completely trusting the Holy Ghost to do what the Lord sent him to do the power of the Holy Ghost will work. He is a complete gentleman, he does not force himself on anyone. You must yield willingly.

sermons.title: The Vision
sermons.description: This is a sermon which warns of the coming hour of persecution for all Spirit Filled Believers.  This is based on the book that Wilkerson wrote in the early 1970’s by the same title.
